title: Screens & Eyes: Ayurvedic Soothers for Eye Fatigue
author: Harish
excerpt: Long screen hours strain the eyes. Learn how cucumber, aloe, and triphala can help—and what habits protect your vision.
content:
Why Eye Fatigue Happens

Digital screens dry the eyes, strain the optic nerves, and overheat Pitta. Symptoms include puffiness, redness, and heaviness around the eyes.

Cooling Ayurvedic Herbs That Help

  • Cucumber: A natural coolant that reduces swelling.
  • Aloe Vera: Hydrates and soothes delicate tissues.
  • Triphala: Traditionally used to support ocular health.

How to Use Eye Gel

Apply a pea-sized amount under each eye, gently tapping with your ring finger. Use morning and night after cleansing.

Daily Habits to Protect Your Eyes

  • Follow the 20–20–20 rule (every 20 minutes, look 20 feet away for 20 seconds).
  • Use warm palm cupping to relax eye muscles.
  • Keep screens at eye level to reduce strain.
  • Stay hydrated—dry eyes worsen with dehydration.
